message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <object name> PLACE <location>
2) WAIT
Only PICK an object if your gripper is empty. Target <location> for PLACE should be panel or a bin.
[Action Output Instruction]
Think step-by-step about your plan and output your idea, and then output 'PROCEED
', give exactly one action for yourself, put on a new line, you are allowed to propose only one action for yourself!
Example#1: I'am Bob, after Chad places the blue_square on panel5, I can pick it up and place it on panel3 for Alice
PROCEED
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
Example#2: Alice and Bob, I will pick blue_square on panel5
PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel5
Example#3: I need Chad places the blue_square on panel5 and Bob pick it up and place it on panel3 foe me, so I will WAIT this round
PROCEED
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT

[Previous Round History]
== Previous Round# ==
[Chat History]
[Alice]:
Bob and Chad, I need the blue_square on panel7 to be placed on panel2. I can't reach it, so I need one of you to move it closer. Bob, if you can pick the blue_square from panel7 and place it on panel3, I will be able to pick it up from there and place it on panel2 in the next round. I will pick the yellow_trapezoid from panel1 and place it on panel3 in this round.

PROCEED
NAME Alice ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel3
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Alice's action is 1.516!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Bob]:
Alice, I understand you need the blue_square on panel7 to be placed on panel2. However, I cannot reach panel7 to move the blue_square for you. Chad will need to assist with that. In the meantime, I will pick the pink_polygon from panel3 and place it on panel4, which is my goal for this task.

PROCEED
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Bob's action is 0.87!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Chad]:
Alice and Bob, I understand the tasks. Since Bob cannot reach panel7, I will pick the blue_square from panel7 and place it on panel5. This way, Alice can reach it in the next round to place it on panel2. My goal is to place the yellow_trapezoid on panel6, but since I can't reach it right now, I will assist with the blue_square first.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel5
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is 1.296!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Executed Action]
Alice: PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel3
Bob: PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
Chad: PICK blue_square PLACE panel5
== Current Round ==


7 panels on the table, ordered left to right: panel1,...,panel7. They form a straight assembly line, panel1 is closed to panel2 and farthest from panel7.
You are robot Chad in front of panel6. You are collaborating with Alice, Bob to sort cubes into their target panels as quickly as possible. The task is NOT done until all three cubes are sorted.
At current round: 
blue_square is on panel5
pink_polygon is in panel4
yellow_trapezoid is on panel3
Your goal is to place yellow_trapezoid on panel6, but you can only reach panel5, panel6, panel7: this means you can only pick cubes from these panels, and can only place cubes on these panels.
Your gripper is empty, can reach cubes: blue_square, can't reach cubes: pink_polygon, yellow_trapezoid, 
Never forget you are Chad! Never forget you can only reach panel5, panel6, panel7!
Think step-by-step about the task and others' response. Carefully check and correct them if they made a mistake. 
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].

When you respond, tell others about your goal and all constraints. Respond very concisely but informatively, and do not repeat what others have said.
Discuss with others to come up with the best plan, e.g. if your cube is out of your reach, ask others for help, and you can do the same for them.
Each Alice, Bob and Chad's response will get an advantage score. If the score exceeds the given number, the answer will be considered as helpful to the completion of this task. 
The higher the advantage score, the greater the contribution.You can find the advantage score information in [Evaluation Score].
If [Improve Feedback] exists, please revise the plan according to the information provided by it to better complete this task! 
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response by either: 1) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!


[Current Chat]
[Alice]:
Bob and Chad, the blue_square is now on panel5, which is out of my reach. Chad, since you placed it there, could you please pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3? Then I will be able to reach it and place it on panel2 in the next round. For this round, I will WAIT since there is no action I can take that would contribute to our goal.

PROCEED
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Alice's action is 1.765!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Bob]:
Chad, I see that Alice needs the blue_square on panel3 to complete her task. Since my goal is already achieved with the pink_polygon on panel4, I can assist with moving the blue_square. I will pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3 for Alice.

PROCEED
NAME Bob ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Bob's action is 1.617!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Chad]:
Bob, you cannot reach the blue_square on panel5 as it is out of your range. I will pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3 so that Alice can reach it in the next round to place it on panel2. This action aligns with our collective goal.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is -1.16!
The score is low and the plan need to be changed!

[Improve Feedback]
Chad's previous response:Bob, you cannot reach the blue_square on panel5 as it is out of your range. I will pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3 so that Alice can reach it in the next round to place it on panel2. This action aligns with our collective goal.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
The advantage score score is -1.16, it is too low to run, the answer may contain a misunderstanding of the state of the environment, you must change your action to raise the advantage score over -0.32!
You are Chad, your response is:

Bob, my apologies for the confusion. I realize now that you cannot reach the blue_square on panel5. I will pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel6. This way, I can also pick up the yellow_trapezoid from panel6 in the next round to place it on panel6, which is my goal.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel6

[Scores]
[Alice Response]:
Bob and Chad, the blue_square is now on panel5, which is out of my reach. Chad, since you placed it there, could you please pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3? Then I will be able to reach it and place it on panel2 in the next round. For this round, I will WAIT since there is no action I can take that would contribute to our goal.

PROCEED
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Alice's action is 1.765!

[Bob Response]:
Chad, I see that Alice needs the blue_square on panel3 to complete her task. Since my goal is already achieved with the pink_polygon on panel4, I can assist with moving the blue_square. I will pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3 for Alice.

PROCEED
NAME Bob ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Bob's action is 1.617!

[Chad Response]:
Bob, you cannot reach the blue_square on panel5 as it is out of your range. I will pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel3 so that Alice can reach it in the next round to place it on panel2. This action aligns with our collective goal.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Chad's action is -1.16!

[Chad Response]:
Bob, my apologies for the confusion. I realize now that you cannot reach the blue_square on panel5. I will pick the blue_square from panel5 and place it on panel6. This way, I can also pick up the yellow_trapezoid from panel6 in the next round to place it on panel6, which is my goal.

PROCEED
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel6
